entries.notes: Used to show empathy or understanding, relating to the 'Feel' part of Feel-Felt-Found.

entries.content: Attempting to isolate the core objection by asking the prospect to choose the biggest issue from a list.
entries.notes: Relates to the 'Isolate' step in Clarify-Isolate-Overcome.

entries.content: So is this just a really polite way of getting rid of me?
entries.notes: A direct phrase used to clarify and isolate the true underlying objection. Example of the 'Clarify' and 'Isolate' steps in Clarify-Isolate-Overcome.

entries.content: Clarifying what the prospect means by a specific term (e.g., 'resource').
entries.notes: Part of the 'Clarify' step in Clarify-Isolate-Overcome or the 'Assess' step in LAARC.
Used to acknowledge the prospect's statement or objection. Relates to the 'Acknowledge' step in LAARC or AAA.

entries.content: Directly addressing a potential mindset objection (e.g., 'If you don't think you can do any better, nothing I say will click').
entries.notes: An attempt to overcome a fundamental barrier, related to the 'Overcome' step in Clarify-Isolate-Overcome.
